utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Gosh, guess he got away. Baby Shoes come out to play? Come on! Hands on your head! Climb out!

utterance.speaker: Baby Shoes
utterance.content: I can’t climb out if my hands are on my head.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Just keep ’em where I can see ’em man. Ah, ah come on.

utterance.speaker: Baby Shoes
utterance.content: You high, popo?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Yeah, man. Catching morons makes me high! Lift your shirt up by the collar and turn around. Oh, would you look at that! Dude’s got a weapon. All right. You have the, uh, right to remain stupid.

utterance.speaker: Baby Shoes
utterance.content: Watch the gun.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Anything you say will be completely incomprehensible.

utterance.speaker: Baby Shoes
utterance.content: Seriously man. Careful!

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Seriously man? Seriously? Does your mama know what you do?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Aww, its sweet. Your dad’s proud. You made the local paper.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: With my article.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Give it a rest! You read what he wrote in the margin?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Our friend Lazarus sleeps, but I go that I may wake him up.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s not proud of me, he’s proud of Jesus. Everything I do right is God’s work; everything I do wrong is my own damn fault.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cop with a sense of humor. Differential diagnosis. Guy’s in the ER, bleeding on everybody.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Drugs?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s a cop.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Good point. How about… drugs?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tox screen was clean. He did however get hit by a bullet. Just mentioning.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He was shot?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, somebody threw it at him.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I’m thinking trauma. He’s got bullet fragments lodged in his brain.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: According to Baby Shoes, the cop was laughing before he got shot.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Baby Shoes?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The guy who shot him.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Reliable witness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: His name’s Baby Shoes, how bad can he be? The fragments are in the wrong part of the brain to cause euphoria. So let’s expand the search, factor in the cough and the cloudy lungs.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why are we ignoring the elevated heart rate?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Because he’s in shock.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What if the heart was already fast before he got shot?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You mean after the footrace?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s giddy, indicates a blockage of oxygen. Carbon monoxide gas would elevate the heart rate, cause coughing and impair neurological function.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He got CO poisoning outdoors?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, all ‘cause those bastards didn’t ratify Kyoto. Or he got CO indoors, and then moved outdoors before he’d inhaled enough to make him drop dead. Test his arterial blood gas. If his carboxyhemoglobin levels are higher then 15% stick him in a hyperbaric chamber. You go check the cop car for gas leaks.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If it was the cop car, his partner would be sick.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well maybe she is, but just doesn’t have as good a sense of humor. Also check his personal car, his work, home, I’ll check the precinct.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Blood test confirmed you have low-level carbon monoxide poisoning. We’re putting you inside a high-pressure chamber that psssh, you don’t really care do you?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Do you live near a gas supply?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Um, yeah me…after like a huge enchilada.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Anything toxic you have at your home? Any uh, paint solvents, anything unhygienic?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Uh, no. No I keep a pretty clean home.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: If you star having trouble breathing, you can press this button, and the chamber will decompress.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Like this?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not now, if you have trouble!

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Ah, it’s broken.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: If you have problems we’ll push it for you.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Ouch!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Muscle contracture.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: How bad does it hurt?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Not at, not at all! Looks wild though huh?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Your brain’s not getting enough oxygen; you’re losing motor function. We should start this right away.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Should I be scared?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, you probably have a carbon monoxide leak in your place. We have a guy there checking things out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sounds ok.

utterance.speaker: Female cop
utterance.content: How about the gas intake valve?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Looks great.

utterance.speaker: Female cop
utterance.content: It’s down in the furnace room.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your system’s fine. If you had a carbon monoxide leak half the force would be sick.

utterance.speaker: Female cop
utterance.content: Then why are you here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was wondering if you could do me a favor.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. I’ve uh, I’ve got a disability.

utterance.speaker: Female cop
utterance.content: These are speeding tickets.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A lot of emergencies. He’s feeling better now, but you never know.

utterance.speaker: Female cop
utterance.content: I’ll see what we can do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where does your partner sit?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The place is a cesspool. But I don’t think I need to test for anything.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope, waste of time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know about the marijuana?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ve heard rumors since junior high.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The cop’s acting high because he is high. He’s got-

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Legionnaires’ disease. It’s a good thing Joe got shot; the whole precinct would have gotten wiped out. Anarchy on the streets-

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It takes 48 hours to test for Legionnaires’.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And only 2 seconds to recognize that the symptoms fit while staring at the rancid, unchanged water of an AC unit.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Marijuana explains the high carboxy, the cloudy lungs, and the happiness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pot doesn’t explain the fact that he’s gotten worse since he was admitted. Why don’t we agree to disagree. Actually, why don’t we agree that you’ll disagree with me while treating him for Legionnaires’? It’s not as pithy, but…

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I feel a lot better. The meds are working.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Heart rate’s normal, COHb levels are down. No fever. Take some deep breaths.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: You seem disappointed.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Well I’m glad you’re feeling better.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: You got a problem with cops?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Please don’t talk.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: In my experience people who don’t just like cops have a reason.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I need you not to talk. No rales.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: These clouded areas of the upper lobes, they’re the infiltrates we found yesterday.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Not there anymore?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They’re clearing up. You had Legionnaires’, now you don’t.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: So you didn’t, uh, you didn’t find anything at my place?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nothing medically relevant.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: So there’s uh, nothing I need to worry about then.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not this time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What’cha doing?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Make sure he sees what’s involved. What we found was fairly advanced, these cloudy areas here and here. These parts of your lungs simply weren’t functioning.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: But they’re ok now, right?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Everything’s ok now.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I’m fine!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You’re blind.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I bumped into something. That doesn’t mean I can’t see.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m sure it’s frightening, but you only think you…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What’s Dr. Cameron wearing?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Dark blue pants, white shirt, black shoes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Oh! Almost, except for the pants, shirt, and shoes. You’re blind.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He really thinks he can see.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He can physically see. His brain just can’t process it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No chance this is a practical joke?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No way. Anton’s blindness indicates damage to both occipital lobes.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Must be from the trauma.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bullet fragments just happened to hit the same spot in both lobes? Stroke could cause Anton’s blindness and euphoria. Officer Krupke is clotting in his brain. Start heparin to thin the blood. Find the clot and yank it out.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The clot would be at the top of the bilateral vertebral arteries.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great! Chase, stick your fingers in there, and grope around until you find it. Oh wait! When you turn him into a vegetable then there’s gonna be frivolous lawsuits. You know what would be better? Contrast MRI. Do we have one of those?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We can’t do an MRI. If the bullet fragment’s magnetic, they’ll move and rip his brain apart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, let’s flip a coin. Heads MRI, tails he dies.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Police-issued Kevlar vests don’t have the ceramic plate insert that would shatter a bullet. They would just catch it. So the bullet shattered on its own, meaning Baby Shoes was using .38 caliber hollow points, which, unfortunately, are ferromagnetic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s just so cool that you know that!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We could do an angio to find the clotting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Waste of time. The skull creates too much artifact. We’ll never get a decent view.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Next best thing to an MRI.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And a waste of time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: An angio might show…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: OH GOD…it’s a coup! Fine go do your angio. When you’re done wasting your time, come meet me down in the morgue.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We’re going to snake a catheter in your femoral artery and up into your brain so we can check for clots.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Keep this on throughout the procedure, unless the pot’s already made you sterile.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I have a stressful job. You got no idea.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I grew up with cops like you. One part bully, nine parts hypocrite.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What is wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Just having some fun.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The man is sick and scared.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The man is a crooked cop.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Maybe you should take yourself off the case, Foreman.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You don’t have to like someone to be their doctor. Hey how you doing there buddy? Just sit still, and we’ll have you back out there scaring the crap out of people in no time. Happy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What did the angio tell us?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What are you looking for?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I called my mom. She didn’t pick up. What did the angio tell us?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That Foreman should be off this case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s a neurologist. Unless you think the patient’s optic nerve is in his spleen.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He doesn’t like cops.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Foreman, policemen are our friends. If you and I ever get separated shopping…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I was just busting the guy’s chops.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: See! He was just busting the guy’s chops. Foreman is essential to solving this case. Medically, what did the angio tell us?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There appears to be some clotting, possibly around the Circle of Willis. Based on the progression of symptoms, the clot is growing. We need to cut into-

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Saying there appears to be clotting is like saying there’s a traffic jam up ahead. Is it a ten-car pileup? Or just a really slow bus in the center lane, and if it is a bus is it a thrombotic bus, or an embolic bus? Think I pushed that metaphor too far.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Angio can’t tell us that kind of information.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, so you’re saying it was just a waste of time?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It gave us some information without killing him.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don’t know that an MRI will kill him!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The bullets have a ferrous base!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Little tiny pieces trapped in his head. They’re not going anywhere!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Maybe it’s worth attempting surgery to remove the fragments.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Surgeons say inoperable, and the patient’s on blood thinners. Other than that, perfect plan.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You got a better plan?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Much! Bullet’s identical to the one Baby Shoes popped Joe with. Let’s see how magnetic it is.

utterance.speaker: Attendant
utterance.content: Did anyone hear a…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I shot him! He’s dead!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: The bullet split into four fragments, no exit wounds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Only used a half-load of gunpowder.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It won’t be exactly precise comparing the location on an x-ray to an MRI.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How unprofessional was Foreman?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Ask him yourself. He’s right here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Worse than usual, better than you. He berated Joe for being a bad cop.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Berated or humiliated?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m not sure. I didn’t have my thesaurus with me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: One implies he took pleasure in it. I want to know if it was repressed black anger, or just giddiness.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Whoa! Whoa! You think I’m sick?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think that an appropriate response to watching your boss shoot a corpse is not to grin foolishly.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The fact that I’ve grown bored by your insanity is proof of nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Dr. Foreman, Dr. Chase requests your assistance!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I can’t even imagine the backwards logic you used to rationalize shooting a corpse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well if I’d shot a live person, there’s a lot more paperwork.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Then it won’t be a problem for you to stand beside the casket at the wake and explain why a cancer patient has a bullet hole in his head.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The man donated his body to science! Yes, it’s a tragedy! If I hadn’t shot him, his body could have spent the next year letting first year med students use the carpool lane.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s set.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Do not turn that on, House!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re mad because I put a bullet in his head. At the worst, all I’m doing now is taking it out.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My bad.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: They have to, uh, shut down the magnet to fix it. MRI’s gonna be out of commission for at least two weeks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well it doesn’t matter; we obviously can’t use it on this patient.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, but there are other doctors in this hospital, and other patients.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That helps explain how they can afford all the fancy equipment. I’m sure not pulling my weight.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Is doing nothing an option? I’m just saying, maybe the clot will break up on its own. The giddiness seems to have gone away.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The blindness hasn’t.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Echo his heart.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Looking for what? The problem is obviously neurological.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Clots are in his brain. The source of the clots may not be. Do a complete transthoracic echocardiogram. Maybe we get lucky. Maybe the clots are coming from his heart.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Heart’s clean.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Where else can we look?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We could ultrasound his legs, look for a DVT. I need you to move over.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Tachycardia, heart rate 150 and rising.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Get the saline wide open!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s bleeding out!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House wanted to thin his blood, sure did a good job!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: BP’s crashing, he’s going into shock!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Intracranial bleeding. We need to relieve the pressure!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We need a surgical team.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Foreman, get out!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Boy is he screwed! We clot his blood…he dies. We thin it…he dies! Am I the only one to find this funny?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Oh man!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m not sick!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you hear the one about the guy who bled into his brain and had to have a hole drilled into his skull to relieve the pressure? Hilarious!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Someone laughs, they’re dying? That’s absurd!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: But not funny.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If I’m not sick, all you’re doing is locking me up with the source. I’ll get sick prove you right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you’re not sick, it’s not contagious and you’ve got nothing to worry about. If you are sick, the two of you are staying in here until we find out why. So you might want to make friends with the pig. Good news is I can finally get my MRI.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No you can’t! You blew up the machine!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not the portable one, Chuckles. Chase and Cameron are bringing it to scan your non-bullet riddled head.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Wher… where you going?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To the office, got work to do. Eat your meals, take your temperature every half hour, and any meds I command you to take.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So I’m just a regular patient now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No! You get your own thermometer!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Check your blood, anyone with an elevated SED rate gets to be Foreman’s new roomie.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He should be a part of this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s a patient.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s not irrational…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He’s not objective.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s got the most motivation to get this diagnosed.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. You’re not even friends with him, why would you care? There’s an area of increased T-2 attenuation is the cingulate cortex.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Kind of mushy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cingulate cortex control emotions. This mushy spot explains the euphoria. Question is, what’s causing the mush?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Question you might want to ask… a neurologist. Foreman is a selfish jerk, but he’s a neurologist, and he’s the only one who’s been in that apartment.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is why he shouldn’t be here. You wouldn’t call him a jerk if he was here. If you think he screwed up at that apartment, you’d keep it to yourself.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No! I-

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well we’ll never know; as long as he’s not here, he’s just like any other patient. Which means we can dump on him all we want. What’s eating the selfish jerk’s brain?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: West Nile, or Eastern Equine Encephalitis…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Test Foreman’s blood. Given that he’s the only one that got it, person to person transmission is less likely then some sort of deadly toxin that Foreman picked up at the guy’s home. Who wants to go next?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Whoa! You’re ready to sacrifice yourself for a guy that doesn’t consider you a friend?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s just a patient right? It’s the job.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey! You don’t have to go anywhere. Joe’s apartment is right downstairs in the lab. Foreman brought back samples of everything.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What was that, ‘Who wants to go next’? Some kind of test?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don’t worry. You made the right call. Foreman stumbled into whatever it is without knowing, and he’s way smarter than you are.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Ow! Damn Chase! You suck at this!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Sorry, it’s this damn suit.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I can do it myself, and I’ll throw that out. What’d the MRI show? I can’t be a part of the differential, and I can’t even know what the differential is? You’d have told any other patient what you found out.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: MRI showed a lesion on your cingulate cortex.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What’s he thinking?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Toxins are in the lead, viral’s a distant second.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You think the lesion could be an abscess?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It’s just a small soft area, more mush than…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Was there inflammation in the lining of the ventricles?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There was an increased signal there, yeah. What’re you thinking?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Staph infection. Toxins lead to neurodegeneration, which causes the lesion.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not without a fever.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The cop had a fever. Mine could be coming; I could’ve got it directly from him or a dirty dishtowel at his place. Give us Ommaya reservoirs, deliver linezolid directly into our brains, and we’re cured.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Samples tested negative for toluene, arsenic, and lead.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What about the blood?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Negative for West Nile and Eastern Equine.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We have to go back to Joe’s apartment, get more samples—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No one goes back to that place ‘til we know what we are looking for. Get some of that cop tape stick it over the doors and the windows.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’ll take all the HAZMAT precautions. The chance of infection is next to nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, I was never that great a math, but next to nothing is… higher than nothing, right?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It’s not your fault he got sick.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It would be his fault if we did.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We should get a sample directly from Joe’s brain

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We can’t do a biopsy. There’s too much edema from the bleeding because you gave him heparin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well I don’t think that this is the time to be pointing fingers. I didn’t give Foreman any.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You wanna give Foreman a brain biopsy?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Come on, really, who doesn’t?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This could be a simple staph infection causing neurodegeneration.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Without a fever, not a chance.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Joe had a fever!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He also had Legionella.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The mush might be forming an abscess. And since there was inflammation in the lining of the ventricles, it makes sense. The staph releases toxins, causes neurodegeneration, causes a lesion.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This is a waste of time.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We should put an Ommaya reservoir in Foreman’s brain to start administrating antibi-

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If I’m gonna be arguing with Foreman, I may as well do it directly.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Kernig’s sign negative. Brudzinski’s sign, single positive. Patient Joe Lureia distal and proximal arm contractures. Duration four seconds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Staph infection most commonly presents on the skin.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Most...commonly? You wanna treat me like any other patient, do it. But the House I know never uses phrases like ‘most commonly’

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re not laughing anymore.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. Think that’s a….good thing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sort of doubt it. Staph would be in your heart, lungs, spleen, liver or kidneys before it gets to your brain. Your organs are clear. It’s not staph.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The infection could be limited to a brain abscess.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which I would’ve seen in your MRI Sign this so that I can take out a piece of your brain.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Let me see the MRI.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There was no abscess on the image.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Let me see it then.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I liked you better when you were jolly.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: MRI was taken over an hour ago. That soft spot can now be an abscess.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If it was staph you would have a fever, which you don’t!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What idiot gave you that?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Put the Ommaya reservoir in my skull and treat me for the staph.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Triangle.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This one?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uh…Circle.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Next.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Foreman why aren’t you answering? Is there a problem?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Uh…Square.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell me your date of birth.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Is that House?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah. Next?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Square again. Why is he here?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because my neurologist is having surgery!

utterance.speaker: Foeman
utterance.content: I thought I was just another patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You didn’t believe that crap did you? Date of birth.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The Ommaya reservoir is inserted into the parietal lobe. My spatial recognition is the issue, not my memory.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oops! Did you say Ommaya? I could have sworn you said biopsy. Hey, I’m just messing with your head. Mother’s maiden name, please.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Get out of my temporal lobe, House.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Hello? You awake? They told me somebody was sick like me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m up.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Your voice. Aren’t you my doctor?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: You’re the guy who doesn’t like cops.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Can you see?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You can’t?

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Not a thing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You’ve been blind a while. The fact that you’re aware of it now, it could be a sign of improvement.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Ah! It hurts so much, doesn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m okay.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: It’s gonna hurt. The morphine barely takes the edge off. I’m gonna die aren’t I?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You die, I die. It’s not gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Why not? Are you just too stubborn to die?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: They took a piece of my brain. Whatever’s wrong with us, they’ll find.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Do you believe in prayer?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Neither do I. My dad always prays.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So does mine.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Do you wanna try it? Try praying?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How is he?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Still dying.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well you’ve mastered another skill though. That’s good.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We have Foreman’s biopsy results. Non-specific signs of inflammation

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That’s it?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His result for staph: Negative. He’s not even a carrier.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, at least Foreman was wrong, too.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah there’s that.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Can I go to Joe’s apartment now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. Go back to the lab. Start retesting all the samples that Foreman collected.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Everything. Bacteria, toxins, fungus, anything that likes to feast on brain.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That’s thousands…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then Hurry! Cameron, suit up. You’re gonna monitor Foreman. He’s on to hand contractures; he’ll be on Anton's blindness soon. Run hourly checks because when he does go blind he won’t be able to tell us. We’ll use the data to construct a timeline so we’ll see how far behind Joe he is.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why are you still here?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You’re being cautious. You’re being…common. When you don’t give a crap-

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How many of your guys have caught cancer from their patients? Let me know when that happens. Then we can have this conversation.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It’s just another case, huh?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’ll bet you can even have unprotected sex with your cancer patients without even catching a damn thing. Boy, I wish I had your job.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Biopsy showed nothing.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How can it be nothing? You cut out a piece of my brain.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It’s nothing personal, we just didn’t find anything.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Can you just up his morphine for God’s sake?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s already maxed out. 20 milligrams per hour.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What about toxins?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Everything was negative.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There was a cupboard above the stove. Did you see it? I didn’t check all the food…but it could be listeriosis.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I didn’t go back. Follow right.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Who did?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House said we shouldn’t go. Too dangerous.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The answer’s gotta be in that apartment. Not going is too dangerous!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You’re thankful. If House would’ve pointed at you instead of me, you’d be the one in here.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Look straight forward tell me when you can see the light.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s your job to go back, you’re a doctor! You go where the disease is!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Say it when you can see the light.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m dying and you’re sitting here measuring how fast I go?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Tell me when you can see the light!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: My vision is fine!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Your left side periphery is reduced!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s fine! I’ll prove it!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Ow! Son of a bitch!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Now we’re both exposed. You got two choices: you can go tell House what just happened and get your own cot brought in here or you can go back to that apartment….you save me, the cop, and yourself.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It’s not SSPE. I checked your past vaccinations against Joe’s. No batch matches.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Does the blood show antibodies for Coxsackievirus? Guys, could you please shut him up?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He’s over his limit on morphine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where’s Cameron?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She said she has some stuff to do. Said she’d be back soon.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Foreman!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Imagine being constantly reminded of the pain you’re about to be in.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: I can’t take it! Stop it, please stop it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Mainline morphine into his carotid could stop his heart!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So could pain-induced stress cardiomyopathy. Either the morphine kills him or the pain does.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You’re condoning this?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m certainly not going in there to stop him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m gonna make you feel better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Joe has a new symptom: hyperalgesia.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The infection is spreading into the pain center of the brain.

utterance.speaker: Joe
utterance.content: Ow, please stop, ow…Ow…

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: His brain is telling him that his whole body is in pain. Because of the location, the painkillers do nothing.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Suit up. Put the guy in a coma before the pain kills him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What if he used cedar wood to hide the pot smell? Aureobasidium fungus can grow there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Did you find any cedar wood anywhere?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. But maybe..,

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Maybe what? Maybe somebody can go back and take a second look? And why aren’t you pissed off that Cameron’s playing hooky while your life hangs in the balance?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Why doesn’t anyone listen to me anymore?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I decided you were wrong.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God, you’re weak. Guy steals your article, tells you you’re not his friend. You still wanna risk your life for him.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Foreman broke my skin with a tainted needle.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: God, you’re weak. Guy tried to kill you. First thing on my list of things do would be to stab him back. Shoot him. I’ve got a gun in my desk. Last thing on my list would be to lie to my boss about it and give the bastard everything he wanted.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I’m not here for Foreman; I’m here to save myself.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ehh…. Even with a needle stick, your chances of infection are pretty slim. That’s why you’re wearing the suit. You wanted to be here. He just gave you the excuse. What does that guy have to do to make you hate him?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Give me the bag. Mildewed dishtowel.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: To retest for staph.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What is that, mouse droppings?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Hamster droppings. Could carry Toxocara. Explain the blindness.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now that I recognize as oven crud.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Could be meat with Trichinella. Would explain the high fever.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What’s with rye bread?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Mold could be responsible for ergot poisoning which would explain the contractures.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Three loaves.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You’re going back in there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Guy who lives on takeout pizza does not buy three loaves of rye. That’s looking too far into the future unless he cares about something a lot more than his diet.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You on the roof yet?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m here. I don’t see any birds.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They came that fast because it’s their behavior pattern. Joe’s been feeding them. Now look down, you see a river of pigeon turd?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Uhhh... no. There’s barely any.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It’s not weird, it’s cheap. Joe’s the guy who looks for the easy way.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably been stealing cable from his neighbors. Why not steal fertilizer from rats with wings? You see a shovel or a dustpan?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Found a scraper; it looks used. Sitting on a bucket.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bucket full of pigeon crap. Perfect home for Cryptococcus neoformans.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Yup.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fungus enters the brain through the sphenoidal sinus, where it dances its triple threat of happiness, blindness and intractable pain. Let’s hope this experience teaches our cop a lesson: don’t cut corners when you’re growing your pot. See you back home.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I was there. I should’ve found it.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah…you could’ve saved us a lot of time.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Give me a flush of ampho B and flucytosine. I’ll start us both.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was waiting for the lab confirmation, I haven’t heard from House yet.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Look at his EEG. Beta bands have been increasing steadily since we put him under. Guy’s unconscious but still in pain.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Beta bands could indicate at least half a dozen different things.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: One of which is pain. The fact that he’s no longer screaming makes us feel better. Not necessarily him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Chase! How’s Cameron?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She’s not giddy.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Fever’s down. White count’s improving.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Has she said anything to you?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You mean like, ‘I can plainly understand why Foreman did what he did and I hold no grudge?’

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What I did, did save my life.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Get in here and help, forget the suit! He’s tachycardic. Wide complex. Looks like V-tach.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It’s not Cryptococcus

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: House was wrong. The samples were negative

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So what is it?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We don’t know!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Give him the amio

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We have any more leads?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Nope. That was our lead.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Foreman!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: This treatment isn’t doing anything…

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Foreman!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He’s in V-fib!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No good! Hit him again!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Come on man…come on, Joe

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Hit him again!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Give him an amp of epi!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nothing!

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: He has multiple system failure.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Foreman.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Foreman. Foreman! Time of death.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Time of death. 12:26 p.m.
